intro: Trachyandra asperata, commonly known as the rough trachyandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asparagaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It is often found in coastal or mountainous regions with well-drained soils. Trachyandra asperata is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun conditions.
